education.ignacio: San Ignacio Concerted Teaching Center - Cádiz, Spain

project-1.line-2: On the index screen you see the latest post.
project-1.line-3: There is also an archive with all available articles divided by categories and subcategories. There is also a search engine to find specific articles.
project-1.line-4: A music player is available where a song will play on loop.

project-2.line-1: The FrutyFest website, an event organized by ByFruty, a Twitch streamer and YouTuber, provides information about past and future editions of the event.
project-2.line-2: It features a table with selected participants and a ranking based on the scores obtained.
project-2.line-3: To participate, users must register and be selected by an administrator, who can also manage teams and game modes in the database.
project-2.line-4: During the event, administrators rate each game mode according to the established rules.

project-3.line-1: The project is an application that simplifies catalog management for companies and allows customers to place orders interactively.
project-3.line-2: For companies, it offers login and catalog management functions, viewing with filters, and managing customer suggestions.
project-3.line-3: Customers, after registration and validation, explore catalogs, manage a cart, give suggestions, and place orders with additional confirmation.
project-3.line-4: The administrator controls user management, company data, products, categories, suggestions, and orders, having total control over the application.
project-3.line-5: In summary, it improves interaction and efficiency in order management between companies and customers.

project-4.line-1: It is a website that has an administration and user system.
project-4.line-2: Users must register to access the content of the website.
project-4.line-3: The administrator is responsible for adding offers and articles.
project-4.line-4: Users can view the available offers and apply to them.
project-4.line-5: After applying, they have the option to generate a PDF with the offers they have applied to, which they can send by email or download directly.

project-5.line-1: It is a website that involves an administrator, teachers, and students.
project-5.line-2: Teachers have the ability to create news and evaluate students who are enrolled in their courses.
project-5.line-3: Students can enroll in any teacher's courses and view the corresponding grades.

project-6.line-1: It is a mobile application developed in Flutter that allows wholesale companies to add products to a database and assign prices to them.
project-6.line-2: In addition, retail companies can register as users to place orders with wholesale companies.
project-6.line-3: Laravel API created by a DAM professor (Abandoned).
